meanings.definition: To shout 'hurrah' in celebration or approval.
meanings.sent1: The crowd hurrahed loudly when the team scored a goal.
meanings.sent2: We all hurrahed when the winner was announced.
meanings.sent3: The children hurrahed with joy as they opened their presents.
meanings.sent4: The mountains hurrahed with echoes of their cheers.
meanings.sent5: His voice hurrahed through the valley, spreading happiness.

meanings.sent1: She hurrahed when she heard the good news.
meanings.sent2: After the performance, the audience hurrahed in excitement.
meanings.sent3: The cat hurrahed at the sight of a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The stars hurrahed in the night sky, twinkling brightly.
meanings.sent5: The wind hurrahed through the trees, rustling their leaves.
